{T}: Add {G}.

(Melds with Titania, Voice of Gaea.)

cards.name: Mishra, Lost to Phyrexia
cards.text:
Whenever Mishra, Lost to Phyrexia enters the battlefield or attacks, choose three -
• Target opponent discards two cards.
• Mishra deals 3 damage to any target.
• Destroy target artifact or planeswalker.
• Creatures you control gain menace and trample until end of turn.
• Creatures you don't control get -1/-1 until end of turn.
• Create two tapped Powerstone tokens.

cards.name: Phyrexian Dragon Engine
cards.text:
Double strike
When Phyrexian Dragon Engine enters the battlefield from your graveyard, you may discard your hand. If you do, draw three cards.
Unearth {3}{R}{R}
(Melds with Mishra, Claimed by Gix.)

cards.name: The Mightstone and Weakstone
cards.text:
When The Mightstone and Weakstone enters the battlefield, choose one -

• Target creature gets -5/-5 until end of turn.
{T}: Add {C}{C}. This mana can't be spent to cast nonartifact spells.
(Melds with Urza, Lord Protector.)

cards.name: Titania, Gaea Incarnate
cards.text:
Vigilance, reach, trample, haste
Titania, Gaea Incarnate's power and toughness are each equal to the number of lands you control.
When Titania enters the battlefield, return all land cards from your graveyard to the battlefield tapped.
{3}{G}: Put four +1/+1 counters on target land you control. It becomes a 0/0 Elemental creature with haste. It's still a land.

cards.name: Urza, Planeswalker
cards.text:
Once during each of your turns, you may activate an additional loyalty ability of Urza, Planeswalker. (You may activate the same ability twice.)
[+2]: Artifact, instant, and sorcery spells you cast this turn cost {2} less to cast. You gain 2 life.
[+1]: Draw two cards, then discard a card.
[0]: Create two 1/1 colorless Soldier artifact creature tokens.
[−3]: Exile target nonland permanent.
[−10]: Artifacts and planeswalkers you control gain indestructible until end of turn. Destroy all nonland permanents.

cards.name: Aeronaut Cavalry
cards.text:
Flying
When Aeronaut Cavalry enters the battlefield, put a +1/+1 counter on another target Soldier you control.
cards.flavor:
"The ground is where wars are waged, but the air is where they are won."
-Harbin, vanguard aviator

cards.name: Airlift Chaplain
cards.text:
Flying
When Airlift Chaplain enters the battlefield, mill three cards. You may put a Plains card or a creature card with mana value 3 or less from among the cards milled this way into your hand. If you don't, put a +1/+1 counter on Airlift Chaplain. (To mill a card, put the top card of your library into your graveyard.)

cards.name: Ambush Paratrooper
cards.text:
Flash
Flying
{5}: Creatures you control get +1/+1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: "It would be folly to fight a dragon engine head-on. Let's hit it from above."

cards.name: Calamity's Wake
cards.text: Exile all graveyards. Players can't cast noncreature spells this turn. Exile Calamity's Wake.
cards.flavor: The sylex's blast had razed the land, leaving behind old snow and sorrow. Urza stood alone in the sudden silence.

cards.name: Deadly Riposte
cards.text: Deadly Riposte deals 3 damage to target tapped creature and you gain 2 life.
cards.flavor:
"Automatons are fast, precise, and tireless, but they all share one weakness: predictability. Learn their patterns. Strike when they're vulnerable."
-Horance, Urzan general

cards.name: Disenchant
cards.text: Destroy target artifact or enchantment.
cards.flavor: "One down, several thousand more to go."

cards.name: Great Desert Prospector
cards.text: When Great Desert Prospector enters the battlefield, create a tapped Powerstone token for each other creature you control. (The tokens are artifacts with "{T}: Add {C}. This mana can't be spent to cast a nonartifact spell.")
cards.flavor: "Hello, beautiful."

cards.name: In the Trenches
cards.text:
Creatures you control get +1/+1.
{5}{W}: Exile target nonland permanent you don't control until In the Trenches leaves the battlefield. Activate only as a sorcery and only once.
cards.flavor: The battlefield became so pockmarked with craters and trenches that casualties were regularly attributed to "fell in a hole."

cards.name: Kayla's Command
cards.text:
Choose two -
• Create a 2/2 colorless Construct artifact creature token.
• Put a +1/+1 counter on a creature you control. It gains double strike until end of turn.
• Search your library for a basic Plains card, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle.
• You gain 2 life and scry 2.

cards.name: Kayla's Reconstruction
cards.text: Look at the top seven cards of your library. Put up to X artifact and/or creature cards with mana value 3 or less from among them onto the battlefield. Put the rest on the bottom of your library in a random order.
cards.flavor: Anyone can destroy a continent. Few have the vision to rebuild one.

cards.name: Lay Down Arms
cards.text: Exile target creature with mana value less than or equal to the number of Plains you control. Its controller gains 3 life.
cards.flavor: She'll swing a blade all her life, but never again for war.

cards.name: Loran of the Third Path
cards.text:
Vigilance
When Loran of the Third Path enters the battlefield, destroy up to one target artifact or enchantment.
{T}: You and target opponent each draw a card.
cards.flavor: As a scholar, she saw the sylex not as a weapon, but as a key to the past.

cards.name: Loran, Disciple of History
cards.text: Whenever Loran, Disciple of History or another legendary creature enters the battlefield under your control, return target artifact card from your graveyard to your hand.
cards.flavor: Urza and Mishra may have been Tocasia's most famous students, but Loran was the true heir to her legacy.

foreignPrintings.name: 歴史学の信奉者、ロラン

cards.name: Loran's Escape
cards.text: Target artifact or creature gains hexproof and indestructible until end of turn. Scry 1.
cards.flavor: As Terisia City burned, Feldon pressed the sylex into Loran's hands and urged her to run. Hope ran with her.

cards.name: Mass Production
cards.text: Create four 1/1 colorless Soldier artifact creature tokens.
cards.flavor:
"I need an army, not a masterpiece. Accelerate output, whatever it takes."
-Urza, notes to his engineers

cards.name: Meticulous Excavation
cards.text: {2}{W}: Return target permanent you control to its owner's hand. If it has unearth, instead exile it, then return that card to its owner's hand. Activate only during your turn.
cards.flavor: "Remember, students, if it's glowing, humming, or whirring, don't touch it!"

cards.name: Military Discipline
cards.text:
Flash
Enchant creature

During your turn, your opponents can't cast spells or activate abilities of artifacts, creatures, or enchantments.

foreignPrintings.name: アルガイヴの盾、ミュレル

cards.name: Phalanx Vanguard
cards.text:
Vigilance
Whenever an artifact enters the battlefield under your control, Phalanx Vanguard gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: The cool, sleek automatons beside her mirrored her own iron resolve.

cards.name: Powerstone Engineer
cards.text: When Powerstone Engineer dies, create a tapped Powerstone token. (It's an artifact with "{T}: Add {C}. This mana can't be spent to cast a nonartifact spell.")
cards.flavor: "Well there's your problem-resonance leak lowering output by thirty percent. I can patch that up."

cards.name: Prison Sentence
cards.text:
Enchant creature
When Prison Sentence enters the battlefield, scry 2.
Enchanted creature can't attack or block, and its activated abilities can't be activated.
cards.flavor: War prisoners were ineffective political pawns, as neither brother cared enough to trade for them.

cards.name: Recruitment Officer

cards.flavor: "Every name on this list is already a hero! Will you add your own to it?"

cards.name: Repair and Recharge

cards.name: Siege Veteran

At the beginning of combat on your turn, put a +1/+1 counter on target creature you control.
Whenever another nontoken Soldier you control dies, create a 1/1 colorless Soldier artifact creature token.

cards.text: Exile target nonland permanent. For as long as that card remains exiled, its owner may play it. A spell cast by an opponent this way costs {2} more to cast.

When Static Net enters the battlefield, exile target nonland permanent an opponent controls until Static Net leaves the battlefield.

cards.text:
First strike

cards.name: Thopter Architect

cards.name: Union of the Third Path

When Carrion Locust enters the battlefield, exile target card from an opponent's graveyard. If it was a creature card, that player loses 1 life.
cards.flavor: No honor. No glory. No leftovers.

cards.name: Corrupt
cards.text: Corrupt deals damage to any target equal to the number of Swamps you control. You gain life equal to the damage dealt this way.
cards.flavor: "Most wise, most thoughtful, most powerful qadir," said the Gixian, "we offer whatever help we may give in your illustrious name."

cards.name: Diabolic Intent
cards.text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, sacrifice a creature.
Search your library for a card, put that card into your hand, then shuffle.
cards.flavor: Gix pierced his disciples' minds and savored their experiences as he took in their knowledge.

cards.name: Disciples of Gix
cards.text: When Disciples of Gix enters the battlefield, search your library for up to three artifact cards, put them into your graveyard, then shuffle.
cards.flavor: "Machines feel no fear, no sorrow, no hunger-only glorious purpose, true and pure."

cards.name: Disfigure
cards.text: Target creature gets -2/-2 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: With a snap of metal like a strike of lightning, the tide of war shifted in Mishra's favor.

cards.name: Dreams of Steel and Oil
cards.text: Target opponent reveals their hand. You choose an artifact or creature card from it, then choose an artifact or creature card from their graveyard. Exile the chosen cards.
cards.flavor: Mishra's nightmares of Phyrexia rang with screams of agony and groans of twisted metal. The sounds stayed with him long after he awoke.

cards.name: Emergency Weld
cards.text: Return target artifact or creature card from your graveyard to your hand. Create a 1/1 colorless Soldier artifact creature token.
cards.flavor: Scurrying repair bots quietly turned the tide of many battles, patching damaged automatons back into fighting form.

cards.name: Fateful Handoff
cards.text: Draw cards equal to the mana value of target artifact or creature you control. An opponent gains control of that permanent.
cards.flavor:
"Get the sylex to Urza at any cost. Tell him to fill it with memories of the land."
-Ashnod, to Tawnos

cards.name: Gix, Yawgmoth Praetor
cards.text:
Whenever a creature deals combat damage to one of your opponents, its controller may pay 1 life. If they do, they draw a card.
{4}{B}{B}{B}, Discard X cards: Exile the top X cards of target opponent's library. You may play land cards and cast spells from among cards exiled this way without paying their mana costs.

foreignPrintings.name: ヨーグモスの法務官、ギックス

cards.name: Gix's Caress
cards.text:
Target opponent reveals their hand. You choose a nonland card from it. That player discards that card.
Create a tapped Powerstone token. (It's an artifact with "{T}: Add {C}. This mana can't be spent to cast a nonartifact spell.")
cards.flavor: "Show me all the delicious misery you've sown."

cards.name: Gix's Command
cards.text:
Choose two -
• Put two +1/+1 counters on up to one creature. It gains lifelink until end of turn.
• Destroy each creature with power 2 or less.
• Return up to two creature cards from your graveyard to your hand.
• Each opponent sacrifices a creature with the highest power among creatures they control.

cards.name: Gixian Infiltrator
cards.text: Whenever you sacrifice another permanent, put a +1/+1 counter on Gixian Infiltrator.
cards.flavor: "Terisia City's fall is inevitable. My master's plan runs as sure and steady as the oil in my veins."

cards.name: Gixian Puppeteer
cards.text:
Whenever you draw your second card each turn, each opponent loses 2 life and you gain 2 life.
When Gixian Puppeteer dies, return another target creature card with mana value 3 or less from your graveyard to the battlefield.
cards.flavor: To some, desecration. To Gix, decoration.

cards.name: Gixian Skullflayer
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, if there are three or more creature cards in your graveyard, put a +1/+1 counter on Gixian Skullflayer.
cards.flavor: "With every culling, we bring this world closer to compleation."

cards.name: Gnawing Vermin
cards.text:
When Gnawing Vermin enters the battlefield, target player mills two cards.
When Gnawing Vermin dies, target creature you don't control gets -1/-1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"Everyone warns about the sand and the food, but the rats are worse than both put together!"
-Sanwell, letter to his family

cards.name: Go for the Throat
cards.text: Destroy target nonartifact creature.
cards.flavor: When Titania offered peace, Urza merely turned her down. Mishra made her people pay for the insult.

cards.name: Gruesome Realization
cards.text:
Choose one -
• You draw two cards and you lose 2 life.
• Creatures your opponents control get -1/-1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Mishra was gone-all that remained was a machine wearing his face.

cards.name: Gurgling Anointer
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever you draw your second card each turn, put a +1/+1 counter on Gurgling Anointer.
When Gurgling Anointer dies, return another target creature card with mana value less than or equal to Gurgling Anointer's power from your graveyard to the battlefield.

cards.name: Hostile Negotiations
cards.text: Exile the top three cards of your library in a face-down pile, then exile the next top three cards of your library in another face-down pile. Look at the cards in each pile, then turn a pile of your choice face up. An opponent chooses one of those piles. Put all cards in the chosen pile into your hand and the rest into your graveyard. You lose 3 life.

cards.name: Kill-Zone Acrobat
cards.text: Whenever Kill-Zone Acrobat attacks, you may sacrifice another creature or artifact. If you do, Kill-Zone Acrobat gains flying until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Her circus training proved surprisingly valuable on the battlefield.

foreignPrintings.name: Acrobate de la zone de tir

cards.name: Misery's Shadow
cards.text:
If a creature an opponent controls would die, exile it instead.
{1}: Misery's Shadow gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: In the ruins of Kroog, only anguish thrived.

cards.name: Moment of Defiance
cards.text:
Target creature gets +2/+1 and gains lifelink until end of turn.
Draw a card.
cards.flavor: "Well? What are you waiting for? Let's not keep the buzzards waiting."

cards.name: No One Left Behind
cards.text:
This spell costs {3} less to cast if it targets a creature card with mana value 3 or less.
Return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield.
cards.flavor: Dying for the cause is overrated.

foreignPrintings.name: 誰も置き去りにしない

cards.name: Overwhelming Remorse
cards.text:
This spell costs {1} less to cast for each creature card in your graveyard.
Exile target creature or planeswalker.
cards.flavor: Tocasia's face haunted his vision. The explosion still rung in his ears. Mishra kept running and never once looked back.

cards.name: Painful Quandary
cards.text: Whenever an opponent casts a spell, that player loses 5 life unless they discard a card.
cards.flavor: In Mishra's desperation to destroy his brother, he allowed Gix to destroy him instead.

cards.name: Powerstone Fracture
cards.text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, sacrifice an artifact or creature.
Destroy target creature or planeswalker.
cards.flavor:
"Move! When the powerstone blows, that behemoth will be nothing but a hole in the ground."
-Ashnod, to Hajar

foreignPrintings.name: Fractura de la piedra de poder

cards.name: Ravenous Gigamole
cards.text: When Ravenous Gigamole enters the battlefield, mill three cards. You may put a creature card from among the cards milled this way into your hand. If you don't, put a +1/+1 counter on Ravenous Gigamole. (To mill a card, put the top card of your library into your graveyard.)

cards.name: Thran Vigil
cards.text: Whenever one or more artifact and/or creature cards leave your graveyard during your turn, put a +1/+1 counter on target creature you control.
cards.flavor: Glacian built his automatons to last, and last they did, beyond even the Thran themselves.

cards.name: Thraxodemon
cards.text: {3}, {T}, Sacrifice another creature or artifact: Draw a card.
cards.flavor: Urza and Mishra weren't the only denizens of Terisiare to covet the powerstones' energy.

cards.name: Trench Stalker
cards.text: As long as you've drawn two or more cards this turn, Trench Stalker has deathtouch and lifelink.
cards.flavor: It can hear a panicked heartbeat from a thousand paces away.

cards.name: Ashnod's Harvester
cards.text:
Whenever Ashnod's Harvester attacks, exile target card from a graveyard.
Unearth {1}{B} ({1}{B}: Return this card from your graveyard to the battlefield. It gains haste. Exile it at the beginning of the next end step or if it would leave the battlefield. Unearth only as a sorcery.)

foreignPrintings.name: アシュノッドの収穫者

cards.name: Clay Revenant
cards.text:
Clay Revenant enters the battlefield tapped.
{2}{B}: Return Clay Revenant from your graveyard to your hand.
cards.flavor: Tawnos built his clay statues for durability, not knowing they'd keep fighting long after the war.

cards.name: Dredging Claw
cards.text:
Equipped creature gets +1/+0 and has menace. (It's can't be blocked except by two or more creatures.)
Whenever a creature enters the battlefield from your graveyard, you may attach Dredging Claw to it.
Equip {1}{B} ({1}{B}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery.)

cards.text:

Deathtouch

Menace, lifelink
Ward-Pay life equal to Phyrexian Fleshgorger's power.

foreignPrintings.name: ファイレクシアの肉体喰らい

cards.name: Razorlash Transmogrant
cards.text:
Razorlash Transmogrant can't block.
{4}{B}{B}: Return Razorlash Transmogrant from your graveyard to the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it. This ability costs {4} less to activate if an opponent controls four or more nonbasic lands.

cards.name: Scrapwork Rager
cards.text:
When Scrapwork Rager enters the battlefield, you draw a card and you lose 1 life.
Unearth {3}{B} ({3}{B}: Return this card from your graveyard to the battlefield. It gains haste. Exile it at the beginning of the next end step or if it would leave the battlefield. Unearth only as a sorcery.)

cards.name: Transmogrant Altar
cards.text:
{B}, {T}, Sacrifice a creature: Add {C}{C}{C}.
{2}, {T}, Sacrifice a creature: Create a 3/3 colorless Zombie artifact creature token. Activate only as a sorcery.
cards.flavor:
"The human body-like any other machine-can be stripped for parts."
-Ashnod

cards.name: Transmogrant's Crown
cards.text:
Equipped creature gets +2/+0.
Whenever equipped creature dies, draw a card.
Equip {2} or {B}
cards.flavor: Fallaji soldiers hated seeing loved ones' faces among the transmogrants. Ashnod devised a solution.

cards.name: Arms Race
cards.text: {3}{R}: You may put an artifact card from your hand onto the battlefield. That artifact gains haste. Sacrifice it at the beginning of the next end step.
cards.flavor: "You want it good, fast, or cheap? You can't have all three."

cards.name: Bitter Reunion
cards.text:
When Bitter Reunion enters the battlefield, you may discard a card. If you do, draw two cards.
{1}, Sacrifice Bitter Reunion: Creatures you control gain haste until end of turn.
cards.flavor: The peace summit proved the grudge between Urza and Mishra could end only in blood.

cards.name: Brotherhood's End
cards.text:
Choose one -
• Brotherhood's End deals 3 damage to each creature and each planeswalker.
• Destroy all artifacts with mana value 3 or less.
cards.flavor: The brothers' rivalry escalated into all-out enmity, and Tocasia paid the price.

cards.name: Conscripted Infantry
cards.text: When Conscripted Infantry dies, create a 1/1 colorless Soldier artifact creature token.
cards.flavor: "Funny," remarked Laga to his squad. "Mishra's lackeys wear luxurious silks in their gilded palaces, while we toil in the trenches eating stale bread."

cards.name: Draconic Destiny
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+1 and has flying, haste, and "{1}: This creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn." It's a Dragon in addition to its other types.
When enchanted creature dies, return Draconic Destiny to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Dwarven Forge-Chanter
cards.text:
Ward-Pay 2 life. (Whenever this creature becomes the target of a spell or ability an opponent controls, counter it unless that player pays 2 life.)
Prowess (Whenever you cast a noncreature spell, this creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)

foreignPrintings.name: ドワーフの炉の詠唱者

cards.name: Excavation Explosion
cards.text: Excavation Explosion deals 3 damage to any target. Create a tapped Powerstone token. (It's an artifact with "{T}: Add {C}. This mana can't be spent to cast a nonartifact spell.")
cards.flavor: Urza's engineers could take weeks to dig out a powerstone. The goblins weren't so painstaking.

cards.name: The Fall of Kroog
cards.text: Choose target opponent. Destroy target land that player controls. The Fall of Kroog deals 3 damage to that player and 1 damage to each creature they control.
cards.flavor: As retaliation for the Warlord's ambush at the peace summit, Mishra leveled Yotia's capital city.

cards.name: Fallaji Chaindancer
cards.text: {2}: Fallaji Chaindancer gains double strike until end of turn.
cards.flavor: She was eager to show the invading Yotians how she earned her nickname, "The Sandstorm of Tomakul."

cards.name: Feldon, Ronom Excavator
cards.text:
Haste
Feldon, Ronom Excavator can't block.

foreignPrintings.name: ロノムの発掘家、フェルドン

cards.name: Giant Cindermaw
cards.text:
Trample
Players can't gain life.
cards.flavor:
"Don't excavate too far into those canyons. I promised your parents I'd return you in one piece."
-Tocasia

cards.name: Goblin Blast-Runner
cards.text: Goblin Blast-Runner gets +2/+0 and has menace as long as you sacrificed a permanent this turn.
cards.flavor: Most goblins can light a fuse and run, but only the cleverest remember to drop the bomb.

cards.name: Horned Stoneseeker
cards.text:
Menace
When Horned Stoneseeker enters the battlefield, create a tapped Powerstone token. (It's an artifact with "{T}: Add {C}. This mana can't be spent to cast a nonartifact spell.")
When Horned Stoneseeker leaves the battlefield, sacrifice a Powerstone.

cards.name: Mechanized Warfare
cards.text: If a red or artifact source you control would deal damage to an opponent or a permanent an opponent controls, it deals that much damage plus 1 instead.
cards.flavor: First the automatons reinforced depleted squads. Then they replaced them entirely.

cards.name: Mishra, Excavation Prodigy
cards.text:
Haste
{1}, {T}, Discard a card: Draw a card.
Whenever you discard one or more artifact cards, add {R}{R}. This ability triggers only once each turn.
cards.flavor: While Urza read books, Mishra learned to read the desert itself.

cards.name: Mishra's Command
cards.text:
Choose two -
• Choose target player. They may discard up to X cards. Then they draw a card for each card discarded this way.
• This spell deals X damage to target creature.
• This spell deals X damage to target planeswalker.

cards.name: Mishra's Domination
cards.text:
Enchant creature
As long as you control enchanted creature, it gets +2/+2. Otherwise, it can't block.
cards.flavor: Power radiated from the Weakstone, binding the dragon engine to Mishra's command.

cards.name: Mishra's Onslaught
cards.text:
Choose one -
• Create two 1/1 colorless Soldier artifact creature tokens.
• Creatures you control get +2/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"Hah. Urza has underestimated my strength yet again."
-Mishra

cards.name: Monastery Swiftspear
cards.text:
Haste
Prowess (Whenever you cast a noncreature spell, this creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)
cards.flavor: She focused her mind on the volcano's fury, and hers erupted in kind.

cards.name: Obliterating Bolt
cards.text: Obliterating Bolt deals 4 damage to target creature or planeswalker. If that creature or planeswalker would die this turn, exile it instead.
cards.flavor: In desperation, Pero called on his memory of a lightning storm that nearly killed his family. When he opened his eyes, only smoke and dust remained.

cards.name: Over the Top
cards.text: Each player reveals a number of cards from the top of their library equal to the number of nonland permanents they control, puts all permanent cards they revealed this way onto the battlefield, and puts the rest into their graveyard.

cards.name: Penregon Strongbull
cards.text: {1}, Sacrifice an artifact: Penregon Strongbull gets +1/+1 until end of turn and deals 1 damage to each opponent.
cards.flavor: His child-lifting act was second only to his cauldron-punting routine.

cards.name: Pyrrhic Blast
cards.text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, sacrifice a creature.
Pyrrhic Blast deals damage equal to the sacrificed creature's power to any target. Draw a card.
cards.flavor: Only the quartermaster wept for their loss.

cards.name: Raze to the Ground
cards.text:
This spell can't be countered.
Destroy target artifact. If its mana value was 1 or less, draw a card.
cards.flavor: First one, then a second, then a third of the ivory towers fell to the invaders, who moved in a circle around the city like an apocalyptic clock.

cards.name: Roc Hunter
cards.text: Reach
cards.flavor: "Never track the roc itself with your eyes, for it will swoop with the sun at its back and blind you. Instead, track its shadow and, when it's almost upon you, heave your javelin upward with all your might."

cards.name: Sardian Cliffstomper
cards.text: As long as it's your turn and you control four or more Mountains, Sardian Cliffstomper gets +X/+0, where X is the number of Mountains you control.
cards.flavor: When Urza betrayed the Sardian dwarves, they called upon the might of their neighbors for aid.

foreignPrintings.name: サルディアの岸壁踏み

cards.name: Sibling Rivalry
cards.text: Gain control of target artifact or creature until end of turn. Untap it. It gains haste until end of turn. Create a tapped Powerstone token. (It's an artifact with "{T}: Add {C}. This mana can't be spent to cast a nonartifact spell.")

Flying
When Tyrant of Kher Ridges enters the battlefield, it deals 4 damage to any target.
{R}: Tyrant of Kher Ridges gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: In war, dragons don't see sides, just side dishes.

cards.name: Unleash Shell

cards.flavor: The new cannon's destructive power more than made up for its unpredictable blast radius.

cards.name: Visions of Phyrexia
cards.text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, exile the top card of your library. You may play that card this turn.
At the beginning of your end step, if you didn't play a card from exile this turn, create a tapped Powerstone token. (It's an artifact with "{T}: Add {C}. This mana can't be spent to cast a nonartifact spell.")

foreignPrintings.name: ファイレクシアの幻視

cards.name: Whirling Strike
cards.text: Target creature gets +2/+0 and gains first strike and trample until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"I will trust desert steel in Fallaji hands over a soulless machine any day."

cards.text:

cards.flavor: While Urza's machines favored defense, Mishra built his to end the war quickly.

{1}, {T}, Sacrifice Mishra's Research Desk: Exile the top two cards of your library. Choose one of them. Until the end of your next turn, you may play that card.
Unearth {1}{R} ({1}{R}: Return this card from your graveyard to the battlefield. It gains haste. Exile it at the beginning of the next end step or if it would leave the battlefield. Unearth only as a sorcery.)

cards.name: Skitterbeam Battalion
cards.text:

Trample, haste
When Skitterbeam Battalion enters the battlefield, if you cast it, create two tokens that are copies of it.

cards.name: Alloy Animist
cards.text: {2}{G}: Until end of turn, target noncreature artifact you control becomes a 4/4 artifact creature.
cards.flavor: "This metal belonged to Argoth before it was ripped from the ground. Now it belongs to Argoth again."

cards.name: Argothian Opportunist
cards.text: When Argothian Opportunist enters the battlefield, create a tapped Powerstone token. (It's an artifact with "{T}: Add {C}. This mana can't be spent to cast a nonartifact spell.")
cards.flavor: "Nature adapts. So should we."

foreignPrintings.name: アルゴスの日和見主義者

cards.name: Argothian Sprite
cards.text:
Argothian Sprite can't be blocked by artifact creatures.
{7}: Put two +1/+1 counters on Argothian Sprite.
cards.flavor:
"Make the exhaust vents smaller next time!"
-Urza, notes to his engineers

foreignPrintings.name: アルゴスのスプライト

cards.name: Audacity
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+0 and has trample.
When Audacity is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, draw a card.
cards.flavor: Bravery outlives the brave.

cards.name: Awaken the Woods
cards.text: Create X 1/1 green Forest Dryad land creature tokens. (They're affected by summoning sickness.)
cards.flavor:
"We expected the Argothians to stand their ground. We didn't expect the ground itself to stand."
-Myrel, Shield of Argive

cards.name: Blanchwood Armor
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+1 for each Forest you control.
cards.flavor: Some armor is forged, some is forested.

cards.name: Blanchwood Prowler
cards.text: When Blanchwood Prowler enters the battlefield, mill three cards. You may put a land card from among the cards milled this way into your hand. If you don't, put a +1/+1 counter on Blanchwood Prowler. (To mill a card, put the top card of your library into your graveyard.)

foreignPrintings.name: ブランチウッドのうろつくもの

cards.name: Burrowing Razormaw
cards.text: When Burrowing Razormaw dies, mill four cards. (Put the top four cards of your library into your graveyard.)
cards.flavor:
"That's odd. I don't remember seeing plans to dig a trench near here."
-Lognell, Argivian scout

cards.name: Bushwhack
cards.text:
Choose one -
• Search your library for a basic land card, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle.
• Target creature you control fights target creature you don't control. (Each deals damage equal to its power to the other.)

cards.name: Citanul Stalwart
cards.text: {T}, Tap an untapped artifact or creature you control: Add one mana of any color.
cards.flavor: The endless grind of the Brothers' War had fouled Terisiare's land and blackened its skies. Argoth's defenders were determined to protect their isle from the same fate.

cards.name: Epic Confrontation
cards.text: Target creature you control gets +1/+2 until end of turn. It fights target creature you don't control. (Each deals damage equal to its power to the other.)
cards.flavor:
"You've let yourself grow old, and your light is dimming. Shall we talk one last time, or must I slay you now?"
-Mishra, to Urza

cards.name: Fade from History
cards.text: Each player who controls an artifact or enchantment creates a 2/2 green Bear creature token. Then destroy all artifacts and enchantments.
cards.flavor: After a long hibernation, Argoth began slowly recovering from the ravages of war.

cards.name: Fallaji Excavation
cards.text: Create three tapped Powerstone tokens. You gain 3 life. (The tokens are artifacts with "{T}: Add {C}. This mana can't be spent to cast a nonartifact spell.")
cards.flavor: Few relics excited Fallaji archaeologists more than Thran powerstones, which they called "eyes of the Old Ones."

cards.name: Fauna Shaman
cards.text: {G}, {T}, Discard a creature card: Search your library for a creature card, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle.
cards.flavor: "I call upon both predators and protectors, for now is a season of war."

cards.name: Fog of War
cards.text: You gain 1 life for each creature on the battlefield. Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt this turn by creatures with power 3 or less.
cards.flavor: So thick was the fog on Argoth's shores that the brothers' forces passed within shouting distance of each other without realizing it.

cards.name: Gaea's Courser
cards.text: Whenever Gaea's Courser attacks, if there are three or more creature cards in your graveyard, draw a card.
cards.flavor: "Even the leaves oppose your being here. What hope have you against nature's might?"

cards.name: Gaea's Gift
cards.text: Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature you control. It gains reach, trample, hexproof, and indestructible until end of turn. (It can't be the target of spells or abilities your opponents control. Damage and effects that say "destroy" don't destroy it.)
cards.flavor: When it came to fighting an army of trees, even Mishra's best generals were stumped.

cards.name: Giant Growth
cards.text: Target creature gets +3/+3 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"Imagine being scared of pixies. Just smoosh them under your boot!"
-Kerish, Urzan mechanist

cards.name: Gnarlroot Pallbearer
